algorithm_tooltip: Encryption algorithm used for the DKIM signature
private_key_tooltip: Contents of the private key PEM used to sign messages
domain_name_tooltip: Domain name associated with the DKIM signature
selector_tooltip: Selector used to identify the DKIM public key
headers_tooltip: List of headers to be signed
canonicalization_tooltip: Method used to canonicalize the signed headers and body of the message
expiration_tooltip: Amount of time this DKIM signature is valid for
hash_algorithm_tooltip: Hashing algorithm used to verify third-party signature DNS records
request_reports_tooltip: Whether to request reports when the signature verification fails
manage_dkim_signatures_subtitle: Manage DKIM signatures used to sign and seal outgoing messages
ignore_insecure_dkim_signatures_tooltip: Whether to ignore insecure DKIM signatures such as those containing a length parameter
strategy_tooltip: Whether DKIM verification is strict, relaxed or disabled
signing_signatures_list_tooltip: List of DKIM signatures to use for signing
from_name_tooltip: Name that will be used in the From header of the DKIM report email
from_address_tooltip: Email address that will be used in the From header of the DKIM report email
subject_tooltip: Subject name that will be used in the DKIM report email
report_signing_signatures_list_label: List of DKIM signatures to use when signing the DKIM report
send_rate_tooltip: Rate at which DKIM reports will be sent to a given email address. When this rate is exceeded, no further DKIM failure reports will be sent to that address
arc_verification_strategy_label: Whether ARC verification is strict, relaxed or disabled
sealing_signatures_list_label: List of DKIM signatures to use for sealing
ehlo_verification_strategy_tooltip: Whether SPF EHLO verification is strict, relaxed or disabled
mail_from_verification_strategy_tooltip: Whether SPF MAIL FROM verification is strict, relaxed or disabled
spf_auth_fail_report_from_name_label: Name that will be used in the From header of the SPF authentication failure report email
spf_auth_fail_report_from_address_label: Email address that will be used in the From header of the SPF authentication failure report email
spf_auth_fail_report_subject_label: Subject name that will be used in the SPF authentication failure report email
spf_auth_fail_report_signing_signatures_: List of DKIM signatures to use when signing the SPF authentication failure report
spf_send_rate_label: Rate at which SPF reports will be sent to a given email address. When this rate is exceeded, no further SPF failure reports will be sent to that address
dmarc_verification_strategy_label: Whether DMARC verification is strict, relaxed or disabled
dmarc_report_from_name_label: Name that will be used in the From header of the DMARC report email
dmarc_auth_fail_report_from_address_labe: Email address that will be used in the From header of the DMARC authentication failure report email
dmarc_auth_fail_report_subject_label: Subject name that will be used in the DMARC authentication failure report email
dmarc_auth_fail_report_signing_signature: List of DKIM signatures to use when signing the DMARC authentication failure report
dmarc_send_rate_label: Rate at which DMARC reports will be sent to a given email address. When this rate is exceeded, no further DMARC failure reports will be sent to that address
dmarc_aggregate_report_from_name_label: Name that will be used in the From header of the DMARC aggregate report email
dmarc_aggregate_report_from_address_labe: Email address that will be used in the From header of the DMARC aggregate report email
dmarc_aggregate_report_subject_label: Subject name that will be used in the DMARC aggregate report email
dmarc_aggregate_report_signing_signature: List of DKIM signatures to use when signing the DMARC aggregate report
organization_tooltip: Name of the organization to be included in the report
contact_tooltip: Contact information to be included in the report
max_report_size_tooltip: Maximum size of the DMARC aggregate report in bytes
frequency_tooltip: Frequency at which the DMARC aggregate reports will be sent. The options are hourly, daily, weekly, or never to disable reporting
default_domain_tooltip: The default domain name used for DSNs and other reports
report_addresses_tooltip: List of addresses (which may include wildcards) from which reports will be intercepted and analyzed
forward_tooltip: Whether reports should be forwarded to their final recipient after analysis
store_duration_tooltip: The duration for which reports should be stored before being deleted, of None to disable storage
submitter_tooltip: Report submitter address or leave empty to use the default hostname
